title-group.article-title: New Expansions of Numerical Eigenvalues for −△u=λpu by Nonconforming Elements

abstract.p: The paper explores new expansions of the eigenvalues for −△u=λpu in S with Dirichlet boundary conditions by the bilinear element (denoted Q₁) and three nonconforming elements, the rotated bilinear element (denoted $Q_1^{rot} $ ), the extension of $Q_1^{rot} $ (denoted $EQ_1^{rot} $ ) and Wilson's elements. The expansions indicate that Q₁ and $Q_1^{rot} $ provide upper bounds of the eigenvalues, and that $EQ_1^{rot} $ and Wilson's elements provide lower bounds of the eigenvalues. By extrapolation, the O(h⁴) convergence rate can be obtained, where h is the maximal boundary length of uniform rectangles. Numerical experiments are carried out to verify the theoretical analysis made.
